answers.answer: Hi there.  These can be brought upon by some form of nerve compression during sleep.  We usually unconsciously assume positions during sleep that may lead to some nerves being compressed.  Other not so common causes include problems with electrolytes especially potassium and calcium.  If the symptoms worsen, I suggest that you have this looked at by your doctor.  For now, avoid too much stress and have adequate rest.  Regards.

Hi,This could be due to nerve compression due to sleep posture. While sleeping make sure your hands are free and don’t get trapped under your body or pillow.It could also be due to onset of diabetes and nutritional deficiency. I would suggest you to get your blood sugar test done and also start a B complex multivitamin supplement.

question: For the past two days, I have notice that both hands to the pinkie finger, i have a tingling feeling especially when I lay down at night to sleep.  Can you tell me what this is?  I appreciate your help?  Thanks Huggy5
title: Tingling feelings
